result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Everett J Daniels

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Everett J Daniels appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Everett J Daniels.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Conference. Defendant also has case 22CF3404 in Branch 16. Discussion placed on the record. Court addressed good JusticePoint Report. Defense filed Motion to Exclude Intent Opinion (Daubert). Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due one week in advance of the Final PreTrial. State response to Defense's Daubert motion and to file Joinder Motion due by December 21, 2022. Defense objection to Joinder Motion due by January 18, 2023. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial/ Motion Hearing and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 16. 

Final PreTrial/ Motion hearing scheduled for February 1, 2023 at 2:30 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 503 of the Courthouse. 
Jury Trial scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 503 of the Courthouse.
Defendant's Motion to Exclude Intent Opinion (Daubert), filed.

Defendant Everett J Daniels in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery and an offer from the state, but needs additional time to review with client. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference date, and sets 09/27/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Everett J Daniels in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Court ordered an oral no contact with Erin M.

Defendant Everett J Daniels in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Everett J Daniels in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
